The stack trace is from shutting down eclipse... are you sure its 
reproduceable when you open a closed project?

What command line do you use to start eclipse? Do you increase the VM memory 
args?

I start eclipse with -Xmx256m -Xms64m

I reopened the offending project this morning and looked at the progress view
details. I saw that the Java indexing service is where it spends a great deal of
time, indexing about 1 file / second (and apparently getting slower over time).
When that completes it moves to 'Building workspace' which gives no indication
of how long it will take. The whole process took about 15 minutes to open the
project and compile 2000 classes.

However, the project finally opened ok. So I closed and reopened it again and
eclipse froze - no UI updates, no logs. I had to kill it :-(

The files being indexed are more than likely jar files so they can take a few 
seconds depending on their size (some are 2-5Mb). This should be a one time 
hit.

Can you start eclipse using a command line like:

eclipse.exe -data \your_workspace -vm \jdk1.4.2\bin\java.exe -vmargs -Xmx256M

Then hit break inside the console window to get a stack dump when the 
workbench appears frozen. Please paste in the trace & check to see if its the 
same after 10-20 seconds.

HI,
I'm having trouble reproducing this particular problem today (lots of out of
memory errors on linux in general though which I'm trying to find repeatable use
cases for).

I'll keep trying and get back when I have something.

Channing

Please provide steps to reproduce, then reopen.

Note: Added protection to JobManager to guard against NPE in discardJobs.

Channing,

You can also verify that the VM is picking up your VM args by running with:

-verbose:gc

This should give you some GC info (too much, but its better than nothing).

Please paste the last part of the trace once you 'run out of memory'.

> You can also verify that the VM is picking up your VM args

They are being picked up. I am going to try with M20040811 ...
Closing as never reproduced in a long time
